subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Angel Syndicates and AngelList
description: A fast breakdown of Angel Syndicates and AngelList for builders.

hook.text: One angel can write a $50K check. An angel syndicate can pool $500K in a week.

buildup.text: Syndicates let angels invest together, led by a 'lead' who does the diligence for the group.

discovery.text: AngelList democratized this: any accredited investor can back deals curated by experienced leads.

twist.text: For founders, a syndicate means one pitch to many wallets. For angels, it means shared risk.

climax.text: Naval Ravikant's syndicate on AngelList invested in 100+ companies, returning billions collectively.

punchline.text: A syndicate turns small checks into serious funding rounds.

quiz.question: What is an angel syndicate?
options: A group of angel investors pooling money together, led by an experienced investor
A company that manages angel investors' portfolios
A legal structure that protects angel investors from losses
